title: The Desk Rearrangement Mystery
setting: Clearwater Analytics, second floor, Thursday 8:30 AM
premise: Someone completely rearranged Brian's desk overnight -- monitors swapped, chair height changed, and everything mirrored left-to-right. Brian is left-handed and the setup is now optimized for a right-handed person.

suspects.name: Sandra Kline
suspects.motive: Brian took credit for her pivot table formula in last week's meeting
suspects.alibi: I left at 5 PM sharp and went to my pottery class at Clay Works Studio from 6 to 8 PM. The instructor marks attendance. I was home by 8:45.

suspects.name: Marcus Reed
suspects.motive: Thinks Brian's messy desk violates the new clean-desk policy and wants to teach him a lesson
suspects.alibi: I worked until 7 PM reorganizing the supply room. Then I drove to pick up my daughter from soccer practice at Westfield Park. Practice ends at 7:30.

suspects.name: Alyssa Kim
suspects.motive: Pranks Brian every year around his birthday as a running tradition
suspects.alibi: I left at 4:30 for a dentist appointment at Bright Smile Dental across town. The appointment was at 5 PM and I went straight home afterward.

suspects.name: Jordan Beck
suspects.motive: Sits next to Brian and is annoyed by his loud mechanical keyboard placement
suspects.alibi: I stayed until about 6:30 PM debugging a deployment issue. I was the last developer on the floor. Then I walked to Rosario's Bar two blocks away to meet friends.

clues.title: Security Camera (Lobby Only)
clues.content: The lobby camera shows Jordan leaving at 6:35 PM, Marcus leaving at 7:05 PM, and one person entering the building at 9:50 PM. Floor cameras were being updated and were offline.

clues.title: Brian's Birthday
clues.content: Brian's birthday is not for another three months. It's currently mid-January and his birthday is in April.

clues.title: Soccer Schedule Check
clues.content: Westfield Park's youth soccer league does not hold practice on Thursday evenings. Their practice schedule is Monday, Wednesday, and Saturday only.

hints.text: Consider whether each suspect's after-work plans can actually be verified for the correct day of the week.
Does the activity one suspect claims to have attended actually happen on Thursdays?
